example.eg: Don't knock yourself on the corner of that table.
There was a chair in the right corner of the room.
I'll meet you on the corner of Jefferson Avenue and Broad Street.
example.egtrans: 我会在杰斐逊大街和布劳得大街的拐角处与你碰头。

example.eg: She found a quiet corner in which to sit and think.
example.egtrans: 她找了个安静的角落，坐下来思考。

example.eg: He cornered the girl so she couldn't get away.
example.egtrans: 他把那个女孩逼到角落里，让她无法逃脱。

example.eg: She had just about cornered the gold market.
example.egtrans: 她几乎垄断了黄金市场。

example.eg: The tycoon seemed to have a corner on all aspects of the oil business.
Zidane takes a corner.
The driver took the corner too fast and lost control.
The mother placed glossy books on the corner table.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 放在角落的, 位于边角上的

example.eg: This car corners so badly it makes me nervous.
The candy shop corners my street.
I can't believe you gave her money! She cornered me; I didn't have a choice.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使…毫无选择, 使…陷入困境

example.eg: It's best to be prepared because you never know what's around the corner.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 在不久的将来, 在近期

example.eg: A new bakery opened recently around the corner.

dsense.name: bottom left corner, bottom left-hand corner

example.eg: The page is numbered in the bottom left corner.

dsense.name: bottom right corner, bottom right-hand corner

example.eg: The time and date are displayed at the bottom right corner of your screen.
The drugstore is catercorner to the diner.
example.egtrans: 药店在小餐馆的斜对面。

example.eg: She didn't have enough flour so she went to the corner market to buy more.
I hope all is well in your corner of the world.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 世界的某处, 世界的一个角落

example.eg: I went to the corner shop to buy some milk.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 住宅区附近的小商店, 街角小店

example.eg: Brian was sitting at corner table in the restaurant.
The company has cornered the market for online book sales.
The actor cornered the market as regards playing the role of a tough guy.
Manchester United have cornered the market in scoring important goals in extra time.

dsense.name: have a corner on [sth]
dsense.guideword: idiom (own enough of to control market)

example.eg: I tried to have a corner on the silver market by buying low priced contracts, but I failed miserably.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 独占某一行业, 垄断某种商品

example.eg: Frank found the kitten hiding in a corner.
example.egtrans: 弗兰克发现小猫藏在角落里。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 处于困境地, 被逼到角落地

example.eg: The post office is just around the corner.
For every "safe" nuclear reactor, there is a disaster just around the corner.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 在转角处, 在拐角处

dsense.name: out of the corner of your eye

example.eg: She couldn't describe him accurately because she'd only seen him out of the corner of her eye.

dsense.name: top left corner, top left-hand corner

example.eg: The author's name appears at the top left corner of the page.

dsense.name: top right corner, top right-hand corner

example.eg: The page is numbered in the bottom right corner.
Scientists believe they have turned a corner in their search for a cure for cancer.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 进入一个新的局面, 迈入新时期, 进入新阶段

example.eg: He's in a serious condition but we're hoping he'll turn the corner by morning.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 好转, 渡过难关, 转危为安
